text:
Selena Gomez made her very first public outing since September yesterday when her friend Connar Franklin shared pictures of Gomez with her and their friends on a snow-tubing trip. Gomez was dressed in all black but managed to sneak a nice little tribute to her good friend Taylor Swift into her ensemble. Fans noticed that Gomez was wearing a Reputation stadium tour sweatshirt—merch from Swift's tour that Gomez made a guest appearance at in May.

The hoodie is available here on Swift's site:

tour BLACK TOUR HOODIE WITH SNAKE DESIGN tour BLACK TOUR HOODIE WITH SNAKE DESIGN $45 at store.taylorswift.com Credit: taylorswift.com

The outing was Gomez's first since she was reportedly hospitalized twice in the fall because of a low white blood cell count, a common complication for kidney transplant patients. After those incidents, Gomez decided to seek additional treatment for her anxiety and depression at an East Coast facility in October. She's out of treatment now and is "feeling much better and looking forward to getting back to normalcy,” a source told People yesterday. “She’s spending time with friends and family.”

Us Weekly's source echoed People's. “Selena is definitely in a healthier place than she was a few months ago,” the source told Us. “It took lots of energy, focus and therapy to get over that particular hump in her life.”

And a separate source told E! that Gomez is "checking in with professionals as her health battle is ongoing." Overall, "[She] truly is in a much better place. She feels refreshed and is in a better head space."

While Swift wasn't on the trip this week, Gomez spoke earlier this year about how much her over-a-decade-long friendship with Swift means to her.

"I have to say thank you to my best friend of about 12 years, almost 13, and the reason why she has been one of my best friends is because this person has never ever judged a single decision I’ve made," Gomez told Swift's audience at the Reputation show she performed at. "She’s always met me where I’ve been. She’s encouraged me when I’ve had nothing to be encouraged about, and I don’t know if I would be as strong as I am if I didn’t have you and your family because you’ve changed my life. And—she’s going to kill me after—but honestly, thank you for the bottom of my heart for supporting someone who I know is the most beautiful, strong, independent woman I’ve ever met. So thank you as a best friend."
title: The Taylor Swift Tribute You Didn't Notice Selena Gomez Was Wearing During Her Snow Tubing Trip
